meanings.definition: To walk heavily or slowly, as if with great effort.
meanings.sent1: The tired hiker plodded up the steep mountain trail.
meanings.sent2: The farmer plodded through the muddy field to check on his crops.
meanings.sent3: The elephant plodded along the path, causing the ground to shake.
meanings.sent4: Time plodded forward, dragging its heavy feet with each passing moment.
meanings.sent5: The old man plodded through life, carrying his burdens with each step.

meanings.sent1: She plodded through her homework, determined to finish it before bedtime.
meanings.sent2: The writer plodded on, adding words to the novel one at a time.
meanings.sent3: The snail plodded along the garden path, inching closer to the lettuce.
meanings.sent4: The student plodded through the difficult math problem, refusing to give up.
meanings.sent5: The ant plodded tirelessly, carrying a heavy leaf back to its colony.
